moves.1... d6: The Pirc.  I sometimes play this as Black as it is slightly more off-beat and can lead to some dynamic positions.
moves.3... Nbd7 4. Bg5: Continuing my development and allowing a potential Q-side castle at a later stage.
moves.4... e5: A slightly unusual move.  I was expecting c5.
moves.5. dxe5 dxe5 6. Qe2: Preparing to castle Q-side or play Rd1.
moves.6... c6: Black is thinking about a Q-side pawn storm perhaps.  I think Bb4 would or Bc5 would have been better.
moves.7. O-O-O: Castling and some useful pressure on the D-file.
moves.7... Be7 8. f4: Trying to opening things up and control the centre.
moves.8... Qc7 9. fxe5 Qxe5: I think Nxe5 is better and doesn't lose a tempo.
moves.11... Ng8: The only square for the Knight that protects the Bishop and avoids Black's King having to move once exchanged.
moves.12... Bxg5+ 13. Nfxg5 Nh6: Perhaps anticipating my next move and trying to hold f7.
moves.14. Nd6+ Ke7 15. e6: Pushing on!  Black's King is starting to feel exposed.
moves.17. Qe8+: No! All over now after Nxd8 then fd8= Q or R mating.  Comments appreciated!
